Bean's final customer is Roger (Frederick Treves), a man who is supposedly a regular at Derrick's. After taking off his glasses, Roger mistakes Bean for Derrick due to his poor eyesight and asks for his usual haircut. Bean then proceeds to use the hair clipper but, despite being as careful as he can, he accidentally shaves off Roger's toupee, causing it to get stuck in the clipper. He remedies it by applying mousse on Roger's bald spot and using bits of hair from the floor to create a new "toupee". Derrick finally returns from his phone call just as Roger pays him and leaves, and Derrick's initial confusion intensifies when Jamie's mother and the man who had the ponytail storm in and demand to know where his supposed assistant (who is nobody other than Bean himself) is as they hate the terrible haircuts he gave (even though Jamie insists he likes his haircut while his mother does not).

Bean sneaks out by disguising his face with the Prince Charles calendar in order to avoid being recognized. Roger then storms in and mistakenly greets Bean as Prince Charles himself thanks to his poor eyesight, before going over to and berating Derrick for his haircut. Bean then finally sneaks out of the door and makes a run for it.

Act 2: The Fete and the Pet Show Following his haircut, Bean heads to a fete where firstly, he is unable to find somewhere to park his Mini, so he instead parks in one of the sheep pens after sounding the horn in order to get the sheep out of the way. Upon going inside the fete tents, he cheats at the indoor games, such as nudging a young boy playing a wire loop game, causing him to lose the game. He then plays the game himself, but after failing on the first attempt, he unplugs it and wins; the owner only realizes it has been unplugged after giving Bean his prize. Afterwards, Bean plays a game called "Hit the Headmaster", where he must throw wet sponges at the "headmaster" (George Webb) in which gets a bit carried away by throwing random objects, such as canned peas and cereal boxes, at the "headmaster". He almost throws a chair, but a nearby teacher stops him.

Later, Bean participates at a pet show by entering Teddy into the competition. In the competition, Bean cheats his way through everything using Teddy despite winning easily due to the other kids' dogs not being trained well, much to the annoyance of the contest organizers. At the end of the show, two kids are awarded a ribbon each while Bean is awarded a huge bone by one of the contest organizers. However, Bean does not want it, so he instead takes a jar of honey to his satisfaction. Following this, he throws the bone back into the tent, inadvertently creating chaos off-screen involving the children and their dogs, who are presumably fighting for the bone. As the chaos ensues, Bean promptly exits the tent with Teddy.

Act 3: The Railway Station Following the pet show, Bean gets off a train at London St Pancras railway station. Unfortunately, he has lost his ticket on the way, so he decides to sneak past a security guard (Robin Driscoll). After several failed attempts, he hides inside a mail bag and crawls towards the gate. When the guard leaves once the clock bell rings, Bean climbs onto the gate, but two station workers turn the gate around to which Bean crawls off the gate (while celebrating that he has made it through) and ends up falling onto the railway tracks. Two station workers appear and put the mailbag (with Bean still inside) on board a train carrying cargo and mail that is destined for Moscow. As the end credits roll, we see short clips of a ship sailing through a rough sea (most likely carrying the mail and cargo from the train earlier), and then of a French steam train and of marching Russian soldiers in Moscow's Red Square (indicating that Bean indeed ended up in Russia).

description: Mr. Bean and Teddy venture into the loft to look for an umbrella and uncover items from past experiences, like the time Mr. Bean had to dress himself on the way to the dentist, or the time he fell asleep in church or when the Christmas turkey wound up on his head and even the time a tank crushed his Mini.
tags: ['british', 'clip show', 'attic', 'teddy', 'umbrella', 'teddy bear', 'boomerang', 'toy', 'sheet', 'wrecked car', 'flower', 'salute', 'vertigo', 'sign', 'firecracker', 'vacuum', 'rescue', 'flashback', 'spider', 'rain', 'character name in title']
synopsis_with_character_names:
During a rainy day, Mr. Bean and Teddy venture into the attic to look for an umbrella so they can go to the park and feed the ducks.

He sticks a tiny drink umbrella into Teddy's head, but finds that his own umbrella is broken.

While looking for another one, Bean uncovers various items from his past adventures, like The time Bean had to dress himself on the way to the dentist Bean forgot that he had a dentist appointment at 9 am. The reminder was pasted on the inside of his coat jacket, which was in his closet. Bean got up late, at 10 minutes to 9 am. He ignored his alarm clock for 8 am, and even an elaborate steam generation system, aimed at his legs, which he blocked with his large toe. He had some light exercises and prepared himself for the day, when he noticed his reminder. Bean panics, grabs his toothbrush, and his clothes and rushes to his car. Bean changes in clothes in the car, on his way to the dentist's office. He uses a brick to keep pressure on the accelerator while he changes into his pants. He even manages to put on his socks and shoes and brushes his teeth before he gets there. He uses the water from the windshield to rinse his mouth. Mr Bean pushes the little blue car out of its parking spot and parks his car instead. In the reception, Bean tries to read the batman comic occupied by another kid. Bean throws water on the kids pants to get him into the bathroom and takes the Batman comic for himself. Bean has a bit of fun with the dentist chair while the doctor organizes himself. The Doctor has Bean's X-ray in front as he proceeds to start working.

The doctor applies the local anesthetic, but then Bean holds the syringe in his hands as the doctor proceeds to fill the cavity. As Bean twitches with pain, he stabs the doctor with the anesthetic syringe and the Doctor goes down unconscious. Bean is in a hurry and decides to operate on himself, with his x-ray in front and the drill in his hand. But then Bean realizes that the X-Ray can be rotated horizontally and vertically. He then drills holes in 4 teeth to cover all bases. He then fills his teeth with filling, which sticks together and consequently, Bean cannot open his mouth. The Doctor wakes up and stands behind Bean, which scares him, and the surprises makes him scream, which opens his mouth.

When he had a Christmas turkey stuck on his head Its Christmas. Mr Bean has new buttons as eyes for Teddy. He gifts himself a pair of Christmas socks. Mr Bean purchases a huge turkey and proceeds to cook it. He stuffs the turkey, but loses his watch inside. To find the watch, Mr Bean inserts his head inside the Turkey and gets stuck. Mr Bean's girlfriend Irma Gobb (Matilda Ziegle) arrives. Bean hides his head under a sheet, as Irma attaches a mistletoe to the overhead lamp.

Mr Bean goes to the pool Mr Bean wants to try the kids slides, but the lifesaver blows the whistle on him. The lifesaver instructs Bean to the tower for adult dives. Bean gets to the top of the diving tower, but gets Vertigo. Bean crawls on his stomach, but still cannot make the jump into the pool. He hangs off the tower, but then a kid comes along and stomps on his hands, which makes Bean fall into the pool.

Parking Mr Bean doesn't want to pay 16 pounds for the parking. He waits patiently for a car to come by, who is exiting the car park. Mr Bean then tricks the automatic gate by putting a trash can in front, to open it. By the time Bean brings his own car to the gate, and removes the trash can, another car wants to enter the car park and Bean has to reverse. Once the car enters, the gate again closes. The little blue car is about to enter the car park. Bean drives at high speed towards the gate. He overturns the little blue car, as he exits. Mr Bean packs for a holiday Bean has a tiny suitcase and soon figures out that all his stuff for the vacation won't fit into it. He decides to miniaturize his belongings. A napkin instead of a towel. Speedo, instead of boxers. One shoe instead of the pair. One underpants with soap. 1 shirt instead of 5. Only the brush part of the toothbrush. Half a tube of toothpaste. A pair of pants cut into shorts. But then Mr Bean that he had a bigger suitcase all along.

Mr Bean brings his couch home. The sofa is huge, so Mr Bean puts in on the top of the car. He fills his car with other supplies from the hardware store. He sits on the sofa and uses a complex system of ropes and brooms to steer and move the car all the way back home. Soon, the car is out of control and is only stopped when it crashes full on into a delivery truck full of mattresses.

Mr Bean finds a boomerang and throws it out of the attic window.

The time when Mr Bean is part of the staff at a hotel, where the Queen is visiting for a gala. Bean is super excited and practices how he would greet the queen. He spits on his shoes to shine them. He takes a breath freshener to reduce the odor coming from his mouth. Bean uses a thread from a fellow waitress's dress as a floss to clean his teeth. The thread gets stuck in his teeth. He uses the zipper of his pants to clean his fingernails. But then he realizes that his zipper wont close as the Queen walks in. Bean manages to close the zipper just in time but then head-butts the Queen when he bows too much to greet her.

The time a tank crushed his Mini.

When he finally finds an umbrella, he looks out the window to find that the rain has stopped. Bean angrily leaves the attic as a boomerang he threw out the window earlier finally lands on the roof

synopsis_with_character_names:
In 1970 a young couple and chaperon come across a grounded UFO. The young man (Peter Gordeno) takes pictures of the craft and the three are ambushed by orange-suited aliens. The young woman cornered and the man is shot. Still in 1970, a USAF Colonel (Ed Bishop) lands at a small airfield and is met by government Rolls Royce and motorcycle outriders. The Air Force officers brief a minister but while en route are attacked by a low flying UFO. The Rolls crashes, destroying the evidence, but the colonel is thrown clear.

The time is now 1980. The young man is Captain of the Sky-Diver and pilot of Sky-1, a submarine launched fighter aircraft, a team of astronauts, male and female, man a lunar base, an ever-vigilant Space Intruder Detection satellite monitors space, and Colonel Straker is now a movie producer, and secretly in overall command of SHADO from a complex built beneath his studios.

It looks like the aliens cannot reproduce themselves, so they have found out a way of becoming immortals in practice by means of constant organ transplants. The water in which they encapsulate their heads allows them to breath in an alien atmosphere (the Earth's) and gives them a bluish skintone. The aliens have been kidnapping humans for some time, in order to extract the organs which will they will use later on on themselves to remain alive.

One alien has survived a crash. Nina Barry (Dolores Mantez) has found out a way to track the UFO's even though when they travel faster than speed of light. The SHADO has succeeded in destroying some UFOs, and they have even trapped an alien alive. Somehow, that alien understands the humans, but absolutely refuses to talk or communicate in any way. When the alien dies, he is analysed, and his heart is found to have belonged to the sister of one of the SHADO soldiers. That girl had disappeared some years ago, and nobody knew what has happened to her until now. The brother is told the truth, but he has to invent a weird lie to tell their parents.

description: Colonel Paul Foster is a test pilot whose aircraft is accidentally caught up in a battle between an Unidentified Flying Object and a SHADO rocket. Foster's plane is shot down and his co-pilot is killed. When he comes round in hospital nobody will believe his fanciful story of what he saw. Until he is made an offer that he cannot refuse, namely an invitation to join SH... Read all
synopsis_with_character_names:
The SHADO and its moon base attack several UFO's. Some of them are down, but in the process a test plane is also sent crashing. The co-pilot dies, but the pilot, Col. Paul Foster (Michael Billington) survives to tell the tale.

Everybody thinks he's gone crazy. In fact, he has reported several sightings some years ago. The nurse (Sue Gerrard), says that Paul must have been confused. In fact, he has been sleeping in hospital for half a week. Ed Straker (Ed Bishop) t ries to convince him that it was his mistake, and sends Dr Doug Jackson (Vladek Sheybal) to give him some psychology tests. Dr Jackson also shows him the black cage videotape, from whose images the UFO had been erased. Paul insists on the veracity of what he saw.

Paul doesn't let it go. The sister of the late co-pilot Joan Harrington (Antonia Ellis) also investigates. Paul succeeds in entering the SHADO and faces Straker, who looks to be about to kill him in one of the film company warehouses. However, Straker finally decides that he'll give Paulo the opportunity to join forces with SHADO, and the supposed sister of the deceased pilot turns out to be one of the SHADO officers.

Paul accepts.

description: SHADO pilot Jim Reagan is on leave and whilst driving down a country road with his wife at night, he sees a Siamese cat blocking his way. When he gets out to tend to the cat, he is rushed by aliens who abduct him and operate upon him. description: Paul Foster and his co-pilot Frank Craig are attacked by a UFO which infiltrates their minds and hypnotises them into wanting to kill Straker. Straker actually saves their lives when their craft is about to be destroyed, but, on their return to SHADO, Craig makes an attempt on Straker's life whilst Foster seeks to discredit him.
synopsis_with_character_names: A UFO gets through the moonbase defense zone and intercepts a lunar module on Earth reentry. The two-main crew is brain-washed by the aliens and given a simple objective: kill Straker. While one crewman takes the direct approach, Colonel Foster starts to undermine Straker's authority and challenge his leadership of S.H.A.D.O. - establishing an alibi and leading up to his own attempt on Straker's life.

description: After an underwater UFO has attacked and sunk a freight ship in the ocean, Straker, Foster and SHADO lieutenant Nina Barry join a submarine crew to find out what they can. However, they too are attacked by the UFO's vessel and, as a result, their submarine is grounded on a ledge. Straker has to overcome his claustrophobia in order to work out an escape plan.
synopsis_with_character_names:
A freight ship is sailing on the ocean. Suddenly, the captain spots a UFO underwater. The alien ship sinks the freight ship.

The underwater facilities of SHADO detect an increase in the temperature of the water. They look for the UFO, and guess that there must be an underwater alien base. A weird green dome is found out in the middle of the ocean.

During an alien attack, Edward Straker (Ed Bishop) and Paul Foster (Michael Billington) watch one of their crewman on the dome. Jim Lewis (Paul Maxwell) denies any knowledge about that, because he was supposed to be somewhere else. Dr Doug, Straker and Foster interrogate him. The good doctor finally drugs him in order to try to extract the truth.

Straker and Foster go down to the dome to see what it is for themselves. The green structure kind of swallows them up. Inside, they watch the officer they had just left at SHADO headquarters walking like a robot.

Suddenly, Foster attacks Straker. Foster also moves rigidly, like a robot. Straker bests Foster in the ensuing fight. Immediately, Straker goes to hide. Foster appears and talks to him nonchalantly. When Foster asks Straker what he has been dreaming about, Straker says "about you", and points to the Foster who is on the floor.

Foster and Straker hide the body somewhere and keep on walking along the eerily lit corridors. Finally, they read a reproduction of the SHADO main cabin. They hear a noise and they hide. Exact replicas of all the crew appear. They can also manipulate and imitate the conversations among the human crewmembers. They can even imitate the static-filled sound. When the conversation with the seabase finishes, all the replicas leave in silence.

Almost an hour has gone by. Straker had told the base to shoot in an hour if they didn't appear. Lew Waterman (Gary Myers) is the person who anxiously waits for Foster and Straker to appear.

Waterman finally takes the decision to shoot the torpedos. The island above explodes as if a million volcanoes started at the same time. Straker leaves on the spot of time.

Back on SHADO headquarters in the UK; they detect a flotilla of UFO's around the moon. All units at moonbase leave it to fight the weirdly rotating UFO's, which for some reason don't defend themselves. :-)

description: Aliens attempt to destroy a naval ship dumping toxic waste into the ocean but their craft is shot down. description: Foster is stranded on the Moon and another astronaut is killed following an attack by aliens under cover of a meteor shower. Foster has lost contact with the Moonbase and is assumed to be dead so there is no search party. Then he meets an alien, also stranded, and the two have to work in a bizarre alliance in order to survive.
tags: ['moonbase']
synopsis_with_character_names:
A UFO lands on the moon while the detection system was blinded by meteor activities. An alien then walks to moonbase and shoots the window of a leisure module, which eventually breaks and kill one astronaut, while Col. Paul Foster (Michael Billington) barely manages to escape.

Foster then guesses what happened and the interceptors find the landed UFO. He goes out to the moon surface in search of the alien ship. While trying to capture the UFO, Foster gets hurt and his radio breaks up; then as the UFO tries to leave it is destroyed, letting a single alien stranded on the moon. Foster is thought dead: his role as moonbase commander is given to Lt. Mark Bradley (Harry Baird) and his death is notified to his girlfriend Tina Duval (Suzan Farmer). Mark does not want the job at first, because he's afraid of the hidden racism.

The alien threatens Foster with his weapon. They walk over the moon surface. Foster takes the alien's weapons, but it has no bullets inside, so from that moment they have to walk together. Paul faints, and the alien helps him out by mending Paul's suit and passing some fresh air from his tanks. The alien and Paul communicate by means of gestures and Paul takes his map out to agree on a common course of action.

The situation somewhat bonds Foster and the alien, but when finally the rescue team comes over they kill the alien, not being able to understand what Foster was trying to tell them.

When Tina Duval realizes Foster is alive and receive no explanations from him, she leaves him.

synopsis_with_character_names:
SHADO does not trust anyone in a way. Psychology tests take place continuously in order to check that all staff keeps on being loyal. They especially measure stress, nerves, etc... However, not everybody believes in the necessity of such tests.

Paul Roper (George Cole) is a technician which works in the UK headquartes of SHADO. He's married to a pretty and much younger wife, Carol (Sonia Fox), who has been lately receiving weird threatening phone calls. She's become a bunch of nerves. One day, she points her husband's shotgun to the door because she thinks it's the person who is making the threatening calls, which puts Paul inthe situation of betraying SHADO to protect his wife. He's told her that, when he spoke to the police, he was told that it was a burglar who used to commit crimes in their neighbourhood, but that he's been trapped. It's not even necessary for Carol to testify in the police station.

Roper starts feeding cryptic co-ordinates to the aliens, the possession of which will allow them to make an undetected attack on the Moonbase. Colonel Alec Freeman (George Sewell) has a short conversation with Paul in the corridors of the hidden SHADO base, and realises that Paul is under a lot of stress. He and Comander Ed Straker (Ed Bishop) interrogate him and test him on the stress level. They discover that Roper is a traitor.

Straker devises a plan to release Roper and follow him. However, Roper is freed before time. The aliens attack him while on his way home to his wife's arms. Carol is terrified once again and she picks up the shotgun. However, she is killed.

Roper is attacked but survives. He is distraught because Carol had died. He will carry out a dangerous mission on the moon on behalf of SHADO. He waits for the UFO which will follow the coordenates he's been feeding them and will shoot the spaceship on sight. He succeeds, but is killed on the process.

synopsis_with_character_names: Ed Straker flashes back to the beginnings of S.H.A.D.O. and recalls the many sacrifices he had to make to get the organisation started and to be the commander of the new ultra-secret agency- including the pressures it put on his marriage to his new bride, Mary. S.H.A.D.O. was so secret that Ed couldn't even share with Mary what he did and why he was often at work until the wee hours of the morning. Ultimately, Ed is faced with the hardest decision of his life: give up his role as chief of the world's most vital defense against extraterrestrial invaders or sacrifice his marriage on the altar of duty.

synopsis_with_character_names: When Catherine Fraser (Tessa Wyett), awakens from a ten year coma an old UFO investigation is reopened. In the hospital, Catherine tells Cmdr. Ed Straker (Ed Bishop) that she ran away from home, met a young man named Tim (Christian Roberts) who had just given up his medical studies, travelled with him to an abandoned farmhouse, and discovered Aliens installing something into the ground. As both young people were on LSD, they playfully stole a piece of the installation, and Tim died, when he just for fun jumped off the farmhouse roof. Catherine cannot remember where the farmhouse is, or what happened to the piece of the installation, which Straker believes to be a bomb. Tim, who was brought back to life by the Aliens and works in the hospital, secretly overhears the questioning of Catherine and visits her. After being injected with an Alien serum, Catherine remembers where she left the missing piece. Now Straker and Col. Paul Foster (Michael Billington) must find the farmhouse and deactivate the bomb to prevent a desasterous explosion.

description: A poet hangs himself in his locked conservatory. Father Brown thinks that it was not a suicide, but a murder.
tags: ['bare chested male', 'disguise', 'in laws', 'fraud', 'kiss', 'theft', 'party', 'ritual', 'cat', 'poison', 'public humiliation', 'paternity', 'embarrassment', 'false identity']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Ex Harley Street doctor Leonard Quinton lives with his estranged and deeply disturbed wife Martha, his mistress and muse Violet. He also has a gardener; an Indian Guru Umesh Varma he met in India when he fled from his wife for three months after the birth of their baby Olivia.

Now a renowned poet Quinton invites Father Brown to this strange household. Lady Felicia and Mrs McCarthy also accompany him. Also at the house is Harris, an admirer of the trouble Martha. Quinton asks Father Brown to look after his wife, a lapsed catholic, because Umesh has predicted his death from the sign of a mysterious poisonous plant growing in the garden.

While touring the garden Harris, Father Brown, Mrs McCarthy, and Lady Felicia who trips over the dead body of a poisoned cat owned by the Quinton's. Nearby Father Brown discovers a small unmarked grave.

A scream from Violet leads them to the conservatory to find the hanging body of Leonard Quinton having, from a note he left, committed suicide.

Inspector Valentine initially arrests Umesh but he is alibied by Lady Felicia. Harris confesses to the murder by strangulation because he wished to protect Martha he feared would herself murder her husband.

Father Brown realising Quinton had poisoned himself, testing the poison on the cat, and was already dead before Harris strangled and strung him up. The first suicide note had been faked by Harris and Brown discovers the real note expressing his remorse and love of Martha.

Martha realising her husband still loved her is prevented from killing herself by Father Brown and a sad confession reveals the she and her husband had difficulty in conceiving and when pregnant suffered from terrible morning sickness. Leonard treated her morning sickness with a new German wonder drug, Thalidomide? This resulted in the birth of a severely deformed baby, limbless and the wrong shape. Her husband fled to India while she sold up in London and moved to the present house in the Cotswold. Three months later he returned with Umesh just as the baby died and they buried the baby in an unmarked grave in the garden and hardly spoke to each other again.

Father Brown conducted a private burial service in the garden for the baby, with a named headstone for Olivia, on which Martha scattered the ashes of her dead husband on the grave.

.

tags: ['thumbprint', 'man wears a bathrobe', 'woman on top sex', 'female removes her clothes', 'bikini', 'scene of the crime', 'starbucks coffee', 'sniper', 'russian spy', 'cherry garcia ice cream flavor', 'smithsonian castle', 'interrogation', 'red zinfandel', '57 shots', 'falling chandelier', 'blind tour guide', 'blind man', 'skydiving target', 'sea shell bracelet', 'removing bikini top', 'skinny dipping', 'bare chested boy', 'polygraph test', 'reference to starbucks', 'reference to club med', 'reference to 9 11', 'pilot episode', 'faked death', 'foot chase', 'house cat', 'zinfandel', 'satellite surveillance', 'impersonating a prostitute', 'wireless synchronization', 'pad of paper', 'first day at work', 'first assignment', 'defector', 'shot multiple times', 'personal digital assistant', 'caviar', 'parachuting', 'note on a pillow', 'shell bracelet', 'black pantyhose', 'female stockinged feet', 'camera shot of feet', 'pantyhose', 'red dress', 'new job']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Annie Walker undergoes a CIA polygraph. She's 28 years old, speaks six languages, her last serious relationship ended two years ago. (Flash back to them frolicking in the surf in Sri Lanka and buying matching bracelets from a local boy.) The examiner asks if it ended badly. Flash back to her waking up to a note saying "The truth is complicated, forgive me."

He asks if she joins the CIA, will she be able to separate her work from her personal life. The machine goes nuts as she says "absolutely."

Jump to Camp Peary, the CIA "Farm." In a plane, 2,000 feet off the ground, she volunteers to jump first. She soars through the air and floats down to the target area. Perfect landing. Two serious men meet her on the ground, with orders to bring her with them.

Orders from Langley, her language skills are needed on a case.

CIA HQ, Langley A dude named Conrad welcomes her and escorts her in. She fills out a bunch of forms and gets her credentials.

In the office of the Director of Clandestine Services The director Arthur (Peter Gallagher) is peeved because someone leaked info to a reporter. Annie takes her oath as Conrad listens to Arthur promise to find the leak.

A tech guy named Augie Anderson (Christopher Gorham) greets her. He's blind and uses a high tech electronic device instead of a cane. He leads her on a tour - including Starbucks - and lays out some of the rules, including that they can't date foreigners. Dating within the agency is encouraged, to further the "circle of trust."

Augie takes her to the Domestic Protection Division Center where Joan greets her and tells her how she'll be outnumbered there by men four to one. She learns about Stanislav "Stas" Orlovski, a top Russian operative who just turned to the CIA. She's been assignment as his handler. Joan tells her she has to go in with a two way device, swap bank codes for secrets and pass for a call girl. There was someone else who could do that, but she's gone.

Augie offers up that he was blinded in in Iraq. They bond over Mingus.

At the Capitol Grand Hotel, Annie unbuttons her top button and goes in to the lobby to wait for her page. A slick Spaniard chats her up, but she turns him down. She gets her page and goes up to the room.

She lets herself in and looks around. She finds Stas passed out on the couch in his bathrobe. She asks if he has his PDA and they sync. Then he's shot through the window right through the head. Annie ducks for cover as bullets from a sniper rifle across the street destroy the room. Listening in, Augie calls for back up.

Annie makes it to the door as the room is slowly shredded. Her handler takes her to the waiting van and they drive off.

Joan and Arthur sit through a tense negotiation that turns out to be marriage counseling. Joan is called away. She's not upset to hear Stas is dead, since he's one less assassin they have to keep tabs on. But she's not thrilled Annie left the PDA there for it to get taken into evidence by DC police. Annie volunteers to go back.

She preps, this time looking the high priced hooker part. Augie gives her a PDA to sync with the others that'll get their info and replace it with harmless numbers.

She strolls up to the crime scene and her giggliest voice tells the FBI guys she was there when it happened. She gets into the scene and tells the FBI guy the john was Boris. She tries to show him where she was standing when it happened and moves a scene tech out of the way to get near the PDAs. She syncs her device from in her purse.

The FBI guy says she can go, but he asks why she really came. She collects the shoes she kicked off before. Christian Laboutins don't come cheap.

When she leaves, the FBI guy calls the escort service number Annie gave him and Augie answers.

Annie returns to Langley. They check out the info. It's useless. That's the end of that. Annie's incredulous. She saw a man get killed, lied to a federal agent, got shot at. Big first day.

Augie gives her a pep talk and invites her to happy hour. He knows every chick there. Conrad's there. Annie wonders why Stas sold them bad intel. He asks why she joined the CIA. She talks about traveling and the guy she met in Sri Lanka and the fact she let her guard down. She liked that in the CIA, she wouldn't get burnt again.

A sultry looking Joan walks into a bar and finds Arthur with a woman, who he says is legal counsel for somebody. She says it's innocent but Joan wants to talk to him. She presents him with phone records and reservations which she says prove the affair. He asks her to trust him, but she's an agent, she can't.

Back at the bar, they take turns observing a woman and making up her background and life story. Annie realizes she's late for her sister's.

Annie drives off, but is followed - aggressively. She notices. She slams on her brakes and the BMW blows by. She plays catch up. The car doesn't have any plates. It stops in front of her and does a 180. She follows. They both drive against traffic. She follows through city streets and pedestrians and jumps on the sidewalk in her red VW. Her car finally dies.

Later, she arrives at her sisters to find a dinner party in full swing. Her nieces greet her. Her blind date is waiting. He has mustache. She thinks Annie works at the Smithsonian. He rambles about traffic, chugs his wine, babbles about racketball and oyster shucking.

The next morning, her sister apologizes for trying to set her up and says she can't believe he tried to "kiss you." Something about the words sounds like something that rings a bell for Annie.

At the CIA, Arthur meets with the reporter, Liza Hearn, who talked to the leak. He offers to be her source instead. Liza calls it a "shameless sitdown" and says she can lighten up with her stories a little of he lays off her sources.

Annie visits her old Russian professor (Clarke Peters) at Georgetown. She tells him she's dating a guy from Moscow and he calls her "Kitsu." She asks what it means and he responds by asking her not to work for the CIA. He doesn't believe her when she says she's not. Kitsu means "kitten" in Estonia, but it's not the most common way to say it.

Someone from Moscow wouldn't use it.

Back at Langley, Annie flashes her badge and is immediately surrounded by cars with sirens. Inside, Joan chews out Annie for involving her professor in CIA business. They're following everyone after the leak.

She tells Joan the real Stas is still out there. The fake guy used the wrong word, hit on her too much and stood by a window plus she was followed last night. She tells Joan about the kitsu thing and Joan sends her away, telling her she might be washed out of the whole program.

She runs into the bathroom, pissed. Augie finds her and tells her how freaked out he was when he joined. He tells her if Joan was going to fire her, she would have done it. The agency likes people who take initiative. She asks Augie for help.

At the Medical Examiners office, she asks an orderly to take a picture of her with Augie. She uses a Listerine breath strip to lift his print and get in the building.

They find dead Pseudo Stas, who doesn't have the prison camp tattoos the real guy should have. Annie's proud of herself for proving it, but suddenly FBI guys bust in, including the same guy from before, Agent Vincent Rossabi.

She sticks with the call girl story and says Augie was her John and wanted to see the dead body. Augie tells the same story.

The FBI guy steps out and takes a call from his boss's boss's, who tells him to let her go. He thinks she's CIA.

Joan gets an NSA report. Wire taps on her husband show he was telling the truth.

Conrad brings Arthur the next day's story, well-sourced.

Joan tells Annie she was right, they checked DNA. They think Stas did the shooting, because if people think he's dead no one will look for him. So he's there to kill someone. They check the threat matrix. An outspoken Russian journalist named Petrov is speaking at the Smithsonian that night.

At the museum, a man dressed as a waiter hides a gun on his cart and approaches Petrov. Outside, Joan, Annie and a team pull up outside. Stas is carrying his gun under a napkin and near Petrov when he sees them and pulls away.

Joan hustles Petrov out of there as Annie makes her way through the crowd. She's stopped by Ethan, the blind date from hell. In the distance she sees the "Spaniard" who chatted her up in the hotel lobby. He runs. She chases.

He leads her through the kitchen, knocking over people and carts as he runs. He throws a liquor bottle on the gas stove and sets off the fire alarm. He races down the stairs and outside to an alley with Annie still on his heels. He runs for the Metro.

Annie reaches the platform in time to see a train pull away. She's looking around for him when suddenly there's a hand on her throat. It's Stas. He marches her down the platform with a gun to her head. He tells her to kneel.

Instead she whirls around and pushes his hand aside. She kicks him, jumps on him, punches him, kicks him, gets choked by him, gets up, keeps fighting but eventually he gets the better of her.

He's choking her against the wall when a train starts to pull up and through her fuzzy vision she sees her long lost beach love, dressed in black, walk up, pull out a gun, and fire twice into Stas. Then he boards the train and is gone. She sees him ride away.

Back at Langley, Arthur gives her the Intelligence Commendation Award, for neutralizing an enemy spy. He tells her she's staying at the DPD.

Annie talks to Joan and tells her she thought the man who killed Stas was someone she knew from traveling. Joan says it was Agent Baldwin, a similar looking guy. She takes Annie's award back - they stay there in the vault.

Joan meets Arthur in the hall. "He" is back. He surfaced as soon as they brought Annie in. Ben Mercer. "They must have had a hell of a time in Sri Lanka," Arthur says. He wants her to keep Annie working to try to draw Ben in.

Back at her sister's house, Annie goes for the ice cream. Her sister comes to say good night. She can tell something's wrong and says Annie's a terrible liar.

In her place in her sister's guest house, Annie takes out her scrap book from Sri Lanka. She remembers her romantic nights on the beach there and still has the bracelet.

In a car outside Annie's house, Ben holds onto his bracelet. He drives off.

description: Annie tries to reach out and protect a mother and son after the son uncovers a coded IRA message.
tags: ['bethesda maryland', 'name in title', 'reference to robert ludlum', 'shot in the head', 'train station', 'hit with a rock', 'punched in the face', 'campfire', 'number station', 'reference to lee harvey oswald', 'reference to ted kennedy', 'walking through a glass door', 'reference to ronald reagan', 'reference to fidel castro', 'title based on song', 'reference to led zeppelin', 'wunderkind', 'encoded message', 'radio signal', 'former ira member', 'mi6', 'double agent']
synopsis_with_character_names:
On her romantic beach in Sri Lanka with her perfect man to the Metro platform where Annie is sure he saved her life. Annie walkes up.

In the morning, her sister Danielle nonchalantly asks Annie to sign her will agreeing to be the kids' guardian if anything happens to her. Annie wants to think about it.

At work, Auggie tells Annie they're moving into a state of the art facility. Joan greets her with an assignment. She has to debrief the "walk-ins," people who come in with tips. Nutjob duty.

Annie goes to a trailer, gets her mace and listens to wackos' conspiracy theories. She hears a a bunch then a woman says her college student son Walter decoded a number station, which are supposed to be unbreakable. The clues led him to PO Box and he saw a man take a blue airmail envelope out of it and the man saw him. Walter is now totally freaked out.

The woman takes Annie to her son, a young teenager. He gives Annie his numbers station info.

In HQ, Joan greets Jai Willcox, who she doesn't think works for her. He tells her he has orders, she refers to him as CIA royalty.

Annie asks Auggie to look into the numbers station. In return, she gets to fetch lunch. Jai sidles over. Auggie bristles. Auggie explains Jai went to Yale, works for Arthur and his father is Henry Willcox, the former head of clandestine service. Jai's the special liaison new initiatives.

Auggie listens to the station with a tech. They hear music at first, then numbers. Auggie recognizes it as a sophisticated code permutation. Walter might have found an active spy transmission.

Helen Newman calls Annie, saying she's being followed since she left Langley.

Joan briefs the troops. There's a missing person's alert on Helen. The broadcast originated in Belfast. They traced it to the IRA. MI-6 thinks the code is for Michael Cahill, who got out of jail six months ago. He planned previous attacks during Lent, which is on day 20 now. They think something might be imminent.

Annie is assigned to go to the Newman's house with an MI 6 operative. They need Walter's tapes.

Auggie pulls a 1960s piece of equipment out of the CIA vault.

Joan interrupts Arthur meeting. She thinks Arthur sent Jai to spy on Annie, but he assures her it's just for division transparency.

Annie goes to the market and prepares to follow her protocol to authenticate the MI 6 spy. She has an innocuous conversation about honey with a stranger and he gets in her car. He's James Elliot, charming British spy.

They go to the Newman's apartment. They have a fancy door lock, which James picks. That day's mail is unopened.

They find old spy novels on the shelves and in Walter's room, tons of electronic equipment and tons of tapes - except from last week.

James goes to check out the other room. The doorbell rings. Annie looks through the peephole and gets the door slammed in her face. A man throws her around and has the best of her until James comes and shoots him in the forehead.

They're about to leave when Annie goes back to rip out the computer hard drive.

At HQ, Joan is alerted about the shots fired. Annie and James race to the lobby but it's full of people, a cop (or CIA guy disguised as a cop), clears their way out.

In the car, Annie worries about Helen and Walter. She asks James how he stays calm, he says he's just focused. She asks him if the life of a spy is worth giving up a family. He wouldn't know, he never had one. Annie arrives home and sees her nieces.

Out at dinner, Arthur and Joan mix business with their personal life. He tells her he wants things to work between them. Her phone rings.

At home in the morning, Annie examines her bruises. Danielle drops by and Annie tells her she can't be the girls' guardian. Danielle responds by telling Annie she only cares about herself and storming out.

Annie beats the crap out of the heavy bag in the CIA gym. Auggie stops by. Annie's angry she keeps losing hand to hand fights. He gives her some pointers.

In HQ, Joan tells them the guy James killed worked with Cahill and Cahill is on his way in to the city and they plan to pick him up. Annie asks Joan what they're missing about Helen and Walter. His hard drive was useless but Annie thinks they're still in danger and his tapes are key. Joan pushes back, but Jai - who was listening nearby - asks what the harm is in letting Annie follow it up. Joan relents.

After Annie leaves, Joan explains to Jai that she's in charge.

Annie goes back to the Newman's apartment.

In the train station, teams surveille Michael Cahill then escort him away.

Annie goes through everything in the apartment. She picks up the picture of Walter with his dad in front of a sign for a nature cabin. She calls and confirms they're there.

CIA HQ Joan talks to Cahill. He tells her he's a peaceful man now.

Annie drives to the nature cabins. She finds Helen and Walter. She tells Walter he was right and they need his tapes. She apologizes to him and promises he'll be safe. She gets the tapes and plays them for Auggie over her cell phone. He puts them through the ancient machine.

Annie waits and chats with Helen. She mentions they contacted the British intelligence last week. Annie goes to her phone. James said they had no info on them. She remembers James' Nicotine patch and him saying they're halfway there, as in through Lent.

She remembers him messing with her phone and examines it. She finds the bug. He pulls up with two other guys.

Annie hides in the cabin with Walter and Helen. Annie grabs the light bulbs Walter used to rig his hard drive and pulls the gas line out of the stove. Helen and Walter go out through the crawl space. The bag guys open the door and there's a blast. James shoots at them. Annie tackles him.

She gets on top and maces him. Then she knocks him out with a rock.

Later, the cavalry has arrived. Annie talks to Auggie on the phone. He says the plan was for a car bomb outside a British bank and James was a double agent. He set Cahill up, and the guy in the Newman's apartment that he shot to build Annie's trust.

She gets in the police car with James. She asks him if what he said about being a spy and having a family was true. He says it was the only true thing he told her.

Back at HQ, Joan apologizes to Cahill and tells him he's free to go.

In Arthur's office, he asks Jai about Annie. He says she's smart. Arthur wants Jai to get as close to him as he needs to in the hopes they'll get info on Ben Mercer, her mystery man. Arthur says he'll handle Joan.

Annie thanks Walter for his help and Auggie rewards him with top of the line headphones.

Back home, Annie microwaves dinner. Danielle comes in and says Annie's an amazing aunt and she doesn't need a piece of paper to prove she'd be there for her kids. Annie gives Danielle the will she signed 20 minutes ago.

description: The Agency wants to get a corrupt Venezuelan businessman. And they decide the best way to do is to get to his mistress who unwittingly helps him hide his illegal dealings. And the best way to get to her is through her brother who is a student and Annie is charged with making contact with him.
tags: ['blood spatter', 'pendant', 'blown cover', 'reference to simon bolivar', 'garrote', 'caracas venezuela', 'reference to thierry henry', 'reference to juan arrango', 'crooked businessman', 'doughnut maneuver', 'simon bolivar quotation', 'reference to james monroe', "man patting a woman's butt", 'foot chase', "running for one's life", 'playing soccer', "hand on someone's butt", 'soccer game', 'street soccer', 'reference to led zeppelin']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Georgetown University, Washington DC Annie plays soccer.

Caracas, Venezuela A group of kids play soccer in the street as a bald dude watches. He approaches another guy and asks who's winning. Suddenly, he's surrounded by men who tell him only the government wins. They shoot at him but he runs. He makes it to his car, where he's quickly garroted to death by his own medallion necklace.

Back on the soccer field, Annie's team loses to a young Latin man who can't stop staring at her. Diego asks her out after the game, saying he'll do anything she asks. She tells him she needs his help getting to his sister Julia.

In Caracas, one of the killers brings his mistress the same necklace.

Annie tells Diego she knows all about his sister, including that she's Victor Ponce's mistress and his personal banker. Over the past few years she's helped skim over $100 million in profits owed US oil companies. She tells him they need to look into the account and see where it's going because they're worried it's going to people who want to destabilize the government.

She tells him they'll protect him and his sister and pay for his education, otherwise his student visa might get canceled. She needs an answer tonight. Auggie sits down on the bench next to Diego after Annie leaves.

He reports back to Joan at HQ and she reminds him he's not supposed to do field work. Annie tells Joan her Smithsonian ID is in place. She wants Annie to escort him to Caracas. Jay reports to Joan that their agent Lopez there is out of touch.

Then he checks in with Annie and reveals he was watching her at soccer.

Diego calls.

At home during morning madness Annie takes in the scene before packing for her trip. She tosses her long lost boyfriend bracelet in, then her sister joins her and tells her to let him go.

In the Caracas airport, Annie looks for Lopez, who she says will be wearing a Bolivar medal around his neck. A woman bumps into her and puts a phone in her hand. It rings, it's Auggie, who points out their agent Rodriguez at the door. Lopez has been out of contact for 72 hours and the station chief is worried. He tells her she might be on her own.

At HQ, Joan and the team try to decide what to do. They're worried they don't have much time if Lopez is dead because it means someone is on to them. They decide to let Annie go ahead.

Diego and Annie go meet his sister, where he introduces Annie as his girlfriend. The sister thinks Annie's too old for her 20 year old brother, but Annie explains she's there for her.

At Julia's house she says Victor is a good man. But Annie tells her he's married, with many mistresses. Annie says Victor will be taken down but she doesn't have to go with him. They want her to tag his account to give them access. Annie gives her a US passport. Julia doesn't like the idea of leaving her home, where she's known as the mother of the neighborhood. Annie cautions her not to get burned by love.

At HQ, Auggie waits to hear from Annie.

Rain pours down in Caracas. Julia doesn't want to prove Victor's guilt, but Annie tells her to do it to prove his innocence.

Annie calls home, saying the account has a password that changes every minute. Victor carries a coded fob and they need it to access the account. She says they're switching Julia's for Victor's the next day after their afternoon delight. Annie and Diego meet up with them. When Victor hears Annie's Smithsonian cover story about looking into a letter Simon Bolivar wrote to James Monroe, he suggests he go look at it with her and Diego drive Julia home, foiling their plan.

One of the agents watching Annie sees that Julia is wearing a Bolivar medallion that he recognizes as belonging to Lopez (who we know Victor had killed). Joan gets a report that Lopez' body has been found in pieces.

Joan and the team decide to proceed. Victor tests Annie's cover story and she proves to know plenty about Bolivar. She and Julia go to the bathroom. Julia tells Annie that Victor gave her the necklace Sunday. Annie tells her she's pretty sure it means Victor killed her colleague. She tells Julia to wait for her at the bank. Julia still doesn't think Annie's right about Victor.

Victor drives like a maniac and asks Annie what she sees in Diego. He thinks she should be dating someone older. He wants her to drive. She grinds the sports car's gears, stops and starts and generally appears like an incompetent driver. He tells her his men searched her car at lunch and found the Bolivar book with relevant parts highlighted.

She comes to a roadblock and can't help but handle it capably. She realizes her cover is blown. She stops and he pulls a gun on her. She unbuckles his seat belt and drives donuts that pin him to his seat as she swats at his gun. A shot rings out, nicking her and shattering her window, then she opens his door, tosses him out and drives off.

Annie calls Auggie. She's bleeding on Victor's car. Auggie directs her to a cabbie with a beard who will take her to the airport. She goes in the bank to get Julia. They sit down at the computer with Victor's code fob as he pulls up outside with his men. The cabbie sees them go in and makes a call. Auggie calls Annie. Julia tags the account and the CIA gets access.

Diego hides from Victor. Julia is having a hard time believing she was wrong about Victor and Annie reminds her he shot her.

At HQ, they see that the money is tied to terrorist groups.

Victor heads for the back as Annie and Julia go out the side door, triggering the alarm. Annie tells her someone else will get Diego. After one last moment of indecision, Julia gets in the car with Annie.

Back in Georgetown, Annie watches soccer with Diego. Julia's having a hard time adapting but Diego isn't worried. They're being moved tomorrow. He joins his sister.

Auggie reassures Annie it was a job well done. He tells her he thinks Joan envies her being able to do field work. Annie watches Diego and Julia and back at HQ she asks if they were able to trace all of Victor's money. He says there were some small accounts in the Caymans they couldn't get into. Annie wants to know where Diego's tuition money comes from -- Julia's account that traces back to the Caymans.

At the safe house, Julia lifts the phone of the agent guarding them.

Auggie and Annie tell Joan that Julia was giving money to kids in the slums and she moved money as recently as yesterday, when she wasn't supposed to have access to phones. They wonder if she would contact Victor.

Cut to Victor coming into the US on a fake passport and receiving a text from Julia. She tells the agent guarding her she's going down for coffee.

Annie arrives at the safehouse to find Julia is gone.

Julia pulls up to a public fountain in a cab. Auggie traces cabs and finds her. Joan tells Annie to stand down, that there are people nearby, but Annie's not listening.

Julia runs up to Victor, saying she knew he'd forgive her. He has her passport. Annie lets the agent go after Julia but Diego bolts, too. She runs after him.

Julia gets in Victor's car as she sees Diego running toward her. Victor's goon in the back seat starts garroting Julia as Victor tells her there's no going back - and then an agent shoots the goon through the back window. Victor tries to drive off. A shot rings out and the car crashes. Victor is dead.

Back home, Annie contemplates her bracelet. She puts it where she can see it, not ready to let go yet.

description: After a routine briefcase exchange at a Swiss airport goes wrong, Annie is stuck at a safe house with a Mossad officer whom she's not sure she can trust.
tags: ['mossad agent', 'man wrapped in a towel', 'safe house', 'car crash', 'wedding', 'smoke bomb', 'hanger steak', 'stitching a wound', 'bare chested male', 'attacked from behind', 'flash bang', 'mix up', 'zurich airport', 'title based on song', 'reference to led zeppelin']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Zurich, Switzerland

Annie (Piper Perabo) lands and spies the man she thinks is her contact in the airport. He's carrying a silver briefcase just like hers. But then she sees another man carrying the same one. One is a blond white man and the other is middle Eastern. A smoke bomb goes off and in the confusion the blond man tries to grab Annie's case. She fends him off and his suitcase explodes. It's chaos.

Watching TV at home, Arthur (Peter Gallagher) sees Liza Hearn (Emmanuelle Vaugier) demands more transparency, saying she was assured by Arthur they'd get some. He's still irked by the leaks. Joan (Kari Matchett) makes him shut the TV off and brings him breakfast and newspaper in bed. She redacted everything about geo-politics and redacted the sports page - the Nationals make him crazy.

He starts showing his appreciation, but both of their phones start ringing like crazy. They turn on the news to see the scene in Switzerland. No one was hurt, but they worry they sent Annie into the field too soon.

She calls Auggie (Christopher Gorham). She's in a hooded sweatshirt and carrying the suitcase in a shopping bag. She tells him there were two briefcases in the airport. She's spotted by the police. She tells Auggie she's not going to make it to the Turk's, the secondary drop off.

She wanders into a hotel lobby and hides her suitcase somewhere inside.

Auggie tells Joan that Annie had to drop her package - not their first choice.

Annie walks into the jewelry store and has a conversation with Fatima (Kathleen Gati), the woman behind the counter, to prove herself. The woman says she has a safe house she can take her to and asks for her passport and anything which can ID her.

Joan goes to Arthur's office to show him photos from the scene. Annie was set up. Eyal (Oded Fehr) made it out with his package, too. Arthur hands the extraction off to someone else, telling Joan they can't risk the op being compromised by the leak in her division.

The woman takes Annie to the safe house. She'll bring Annie her new passport soon.

Annie has hair dye and instant mac n' cheese to keep her occupied. In the safe house she's jumped from behind. She quickly realizes it's her contact Eyal. Both wonders what the other is doing there.

Annie doesn't understand how the simple brush-by went bad. He's outraged she dropped her package. He hacks a police scanner.

Arthur meets with Liza in a park. He tells her she broke the rules by mentioning his name on air. She thinks he's making empty threats, but he says she can be the judge if she breaks any more rules.

While Eyal is in the shower, Annie calls Auggie to brainstorm where he might have hid his suitcase. Auggie checks his file and thinks the brush pass is beneath his pay grade.

Eyal gets out of the shower and breaks her phone in two, pointing out someone in one of their agencies spoiled the op.

In Langley, Auggie works to locate Annie when one of Arthur's leak detectors orders him to take a polygraph. Joan tells him to go with it.

Annie is preparing to cut and dye her hair when Eyal calls for her from the other room. He whipped up a little hanger steak with charred eggplant and pine nuts. She won't eat until he tastes it first. He stowed away on a food service truck from the airport.

He looks at the shrapnel cut in her neck and says it needs to be stitched.

Arthur tries to talk to Joan, who's mad at being kept out of the loop. She doesn't even know what's in the briefcases. She says she's the only one he can really trust and he's doing his best to alienate her.

Eyal stitches Annie up. He doesn't know what's in his briefcase either. He says they're just cogs in a wheel. He finds the black leather S & M gear she found earlier.

He asks her where her package is and if she left it with the Turk. They look out the window and see guys arriving in a power company van, but it's Sunday and their shoes are all wrong. One of them is the blond man from the airport.

Soon, they're going through the safe house with guns drawn.

Annie uses the leather gloves from the bondage gear to slide down the elevator cables. The car starts moving and Eyal presses against the wall as it passes. It stops and Annie hears gunshots and sees Eyal running away.

At Langley, Auggie sits for his polygraph. He's not happy about it. When the examiner asks if he's blind, he says no. It doesn't say he's lying. He says he knows how to beat the machine. He's subjected to a lot of questions about his satisfaction with his job.

In Switzerland, Annie goes back to the jewelry store. She finds her initial contact dead. Eyal comes in and she handcuffs him. He swears she was dead when he got there.

She remembers in the airport he put his sunglasses on before the flash bangs went off. She calls Langley but gets one of Arthur's guys instead of Auggie. Eyal tries to convince her to use him, even if she can't trust him. He has her passport. She hangs up.

Auggie's examiner asks him if he wants to punish the agency for what happened to him. He asks if he's Liza's source. Auggie says no. The machine doesn't budge.

Annie and Eyal go to get her briefcase. He keeps trying to guess where it is. She takes him to the hotel ballroom where she hid it. There's a wedding underway and it's under the bride's chair.

Arthur tells Joan the Zurich operation was compromised on the Mossad side by the blond guy, a former agent.

Annie and Eyal mingle. He recognizes an off-duty police officer. They dance to blend. Eyal breaks off to ask the bride to dance so Annie can grab the package. But she says no, she's in a cast from a biking accident. Annie sees the bride glaring at the groom, who's on his way to drunken idiocy.

Annie takes the groom to the bar to do shots until the bride comes over to yell at him. Annie walks away and finds the package is gone. She thinks Eyal has bailed, but he pulls up outside with both packages.

In the car, he tells her he was sent on the mission because he missed a ferry so the guy he was escorting could say good-bye to his kid. He didn't follow protocol.

He's driving to another safe house out of town - when their car is nailed by a speeding SUV.

The bad blond Mossad and his guys get out. Eyal and Annie are OK and he comes out shooting, taking the blond guy out. Annie grabs her suitcase but the two are quickly surrounded by cops.

The officer runs up and tells them they have planes to catch.

At the airport, Eyal says he knew the bad guys were Mossad by the way they stormed the safe house. Annie says he owes Langley an apology. He agrees. "Plus, I'm horribly embarrassed by their inability to take us out, it's a national disgrace that you and I are still walking."

With their flights called, they finally make their exchange. He suggests the beaches in Israel next time.

At home, Joan and Arthur lie in bed. She asks him if he read her in about Zurich as her boss or husband. He doesn't know how to answer.

Annie lands in the U.S. and hands off her suitcase, mission complete.

description: Annie is given the difficult task of asking a reclusive former officer for assistance as the agency tries to track down an African arms dealer who is trying to enter the United States.
tags: ['woman wears a red dress', 'arms dealer', 'fly fishing', 'brooklyn shipyard', 'sniper', 'double barreled shotgun', 'fishing', 'shell bracelet', 'title based on song', 'reference to led zeppelin']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Annie (Piper Perabo) brings Auggie (Christopher Gorham) coffee on her morning run and gets her a spiffy new cell phone in return. An agent races by her into Joan's office.

They've got a line on three surface-to-air missiles on a container ship from South Africa. They'll be in the US in the next 24 hours. They don't know where, but the shipper is Hassan Walid.

On a cargo ship, the captain demands more money for bribes but Walid shoots him dead and asks other crew members if they want more money as well. Understandably, none do.

Joan (Kari Matchett) and the team brainstorm. Jai (Sendhil Ramamurthy) suggests checking in with Amsterdam. Someone suggests McAuley. There's a pregnant pause.

Joan tells Annie to track down "McAuley." "You're new, you might have a shot," Joan says.

Later, Annie asks Auggie what she meant. Christopher McAuley (Eriq La Salle) was a deep cover officer for 15 years and knew everything about east Africa. He retired five years ago, meaning he had a nervous breakdown. Auggie tells her pretty much every senior person has tried to bring him in. Annie realizes she's on a fool's errand.

Jai greets his dad, the former director Henry Wilcox (Gregory Itzin).

Auggie generally disapproves of him, saying he ran more dark ops than anyone since the Cold War. He tells her the story about Henry and Jai's mom. She was his asset when he was in India, her cover was blown, he married her and then he left her for a younger woman.

She says the press called him "the Prince of Darkness." Jai walks up in time to hear. Auggie excuses himself. Jai asks her for coffee, then it becomes drinks and talks of dating.

Annie drives down a country road until her tire blows - or more accurately, is popped by spike strips. Dogs come after her. Then the presumed Chris McAuley comes out. He guesses she's from Langley and tells her to get off his property. She says she has a flat tire. He replies he hopes that she has a spare. What a gentleman.

Back at Langley, Jai reports Hassan's cousin worked at the Johannesburg port which is how the missiles got on the ship. Worse, they now know Hassan is on the ship himself.

Annie changes her tire on Cauley's property. She's about to leave but goes looking for him. She subdues his dogs with treats.

She finds him fishing in a stream in waders. He ignores her so she takes off her heels and wades in. He guesses she's new. She tells him about the weapons shipment. He ignores her and works on his fly casting. She takes it and ties it for him.

She tells him it's for the greater good. But he says the only mud he likes is the kind he's standing in. When she asks what he means, he tells her to ask Henry Wilcox.

Annie drives back to the city. She remembers her time on the beach with Ben (Eion Bailey), as he taught her how to tie lures. She tells him about growing up as a military brat and wanting to be the master of her own destiny.

Khartoum, Sudan A man walks into his house and sees Ben Mercer waiting for him. He reaches for his knife as Ben asks where his boss is: Hassan Walid. The man draws his knife and Ben fends him off. They fight all over the house until Ben gets him in a chokehold. He asks again where Walid is but the man passes out.

Annie gets drinks with Auggie and he calls her out for staring at the Wilcoxes across the room. Annie decides to go join them, based on what McAuley said. Auggie playfully whines about being left alone. Annie assures him another girl will join him as soon as she leaves. Sure enough, a girl sits and says, "Hi" before Annie even takes 5 steps away.

Jai's clearly irked she's butting in, but she orders scotch and makes herself at home. They're several rounds in when Henry calls her out for disapproving of him. He gives a little speech about things not being black and white.

Annie asks why people leave the company. Henry says it's always for money or love.

Annie goes back to Langley and reads up on McAuley. She sees he was station chief in Khartoum. She looks at the agents he was stationed with and finds Vanessa Sinclair, killed in action in 2005.

Annie's sitting in the lobby when Auggie joins her. She asks about the girl. He says she couldn't remember the title of the last book she read, which was a deal-breaker. She asks him how he feels about what they do. She wonders if it's worth it. She thinks he might have something she can use with McAuley, but she's torn.

Annie wakes up and sees her Ben bracelet. She wears it when she goes again to see McAuley. She tells him she wants to talk about Vanessa.

She tells him he's trying to scare people off, but she thinks it's an act. She knows Vanessa worked for Henry's dark ops group. Every vacation he took for 10 years was in the same area where Vanessa as stationed.

"I know what it's like to hang onto a memory," she tells him.

He sees the bracelet and the knot and asks if she loved the person who taught her that. Very much, she says.

She recites Vanessa was killed five years ago in Sudan, her death was tied to Hassan Walid. She tells him to work his contacts for her, if not the greater good. He's impressed.

"You're talented enough to go very far in this business, and foolish enough to want to," he tells her.

Joan reports to Arthur (Peter Gallagher) that Annie got McAuley, but he wants to take her to see his contact in New York. He also needs $250,000 for the contact. Arthur tells her to send Jai and $100,000 should work.

Arthur's secretary tells him Henry Wilcox is there to see him.

Arthur stalls then finally sees him. Henry knows one of the cases they're working is Hassan Walid. He suggests they turn him rather than locking him up. "There are some stories that will do no one any good to have out in the open," Henry says.

Auggie gives Annie and Jai a suitcase full of money, explaining each bill has an RFID signal and many together can be traced.

New York City Jai, Annie and McAuley wait for his contact. McAuley offers up out of nowhere to Jai that his father is an "a--hole." Jai doesn't argue. McAuley goes to meet his contact, contrary to the plan. Annie whips out her smart phone to show Jai the video she just took of everyone walking by. She calls Auggie to have him trace the people.

Annie chats with Jai until McAuley comes back, with the case. He reports his contact said he didn't trust him, then excuses himself to go to the bathroom. Annie thinks his demeanor was all wrong. They open the case and find phone books. They go in the coffee shops to look for him and discover he's gone.

They check in with Langley. Annie thinks McAuley got info he could use. They trace the money to a restaurant owned by a guy named Sadiq. Joan gives them the green light to go in.

Jai finds a secret door then a brick wall with loose bricks. He pulls out a piece of the wall and finds drugs and guns and their money.

Annie and Jai sit down with Sadiq.

Joan reports to Arthur that Walid is on the SS Andromeda docking in Brooklyn. She's ready to send in the FBI, but Arthur says they're going to run the op.

Jai and Annie get orders to go back to Langley. But Annie feels responsible. She hails a cab to the Brooklyn shipyard.

When Annie and Jai pull up, a team is already on the scene. Auggie gets a report. Annie and Jai are there. They find McAuley with a rifle. She tells them this isn't his fight. She thinks the FBI is coming. He tells her the CIA gave Hassan his start and he killed Vanessa when she brought him guns and money - and the CIA went on working with him until he turned on them.

Joan gives the command for them to take Hassan alive. McAuley tells Annie to get out of the way, but she won't. He gives in.

They hear a shot ring out. Hassan falls. Back in Langley, they try to figure out what happened. Arthur demands to know who fired.

We see who it was: Annie's mystery lover Ben Mercer.

Ben tosses his rifle and scales the boat to escape. He runs down the dock, coming up right behind Annie. She doesn't look his way but Jai does. He takes off after Ben. Jai has nearly caught up when Ben gets the drop on him. With gun drawn, Ben stares down Jai but lets him go.

McAuley examines the missiles: US made, the same ones the CIA sold him.

Arthur leads the dedication of the new ops center in Henry Wilcox's name, pledging transparency.

Auggie hears Jai giving an interview and says he's a blowhard like his dad. But Annie defends him, saying he's just trying to figure this place out.

Joan confronts Arthur, saying he knew those weapons were theirs. He admits Hassan was an asset who built his entire operation on their guns and money. They sent Vanessa Sinclair to deliver a shipment. He killed her, then used the weapons they'd given him to build a terrorist cell. Arthur said he didn't know until Wilcox told him. They were both there when Wilcox started the op.

They know it was Ben Mercer who killed Hassan.

Cut to Ben wounded and drinking Scotch by himself. He looks at a picture of Annie on his cell' phone.

description: Annie discovers that the wife of a U.S. senator is selling secrets to the Indonesians and is planning to frame the senator's chief of staff, with whom he is having an affair.
tags: ['hitman', 'framed for treason', 'compromised mission', 'booby trap', 'aborting mission', 'shot with a flare', 'syringe', 'extramarital affair', 'margarita', 'senator resignation', 'information leak', 'title based on song', 'reference to led zeppelin']
synopsis_with_character_names:
In the kitchen at breakfast, Annie (Piper Perabo) watches as her sister Danielle's husband Michael tells her he might not be home for dinner because he's busy at work. They're also not going to the Greenbriar next week like they planned.

At work, Annie razzes Auggie (Christopher Gorham) for wearing the same clothes he was wearing yesterday. He won't tell her who he spent the night with.

Joan (Kari Matchett) tells Auggie he's on a special assignment this week.

In the conference room, Joan shows the team footage of a drone - the compromised third mission in two weeks . They've narrowed the leak down to a member of the Senate intelligence committee.

The briefing rooms they use are secure, not even note-taking is allowed. Jai (Sendhil Ramamurthy) says the mission is completely off-book. They're using the young agents because they'll blend on capitol hill.

Annie has Gil Jarvis (D.W. Moffett), the committee chair. They're pretty sure he's not the leak.

Annie reports to the senator's office with her Smithsonian cover, saying she's there to switch out the art. Gil says his wife Madeline (Lauren Holly) does all the decorating. She meets Gil's very young chief of staff Ashley (Anna Camp) and listens to her telling Jarvis she has to brief him on Pakistan.

Later, Annie takes a painting off the wall with the help of a maintenance guy. She recognizes his accent as Brazilian and butters him up speaking Portuguese. He mentions the senator works late on Tuesdays. She takes note of his key card.

Annie riding back to Langley when she goes by a hotel and sees her brother-in-law coming out.

At Langley, Annie tells Jai about the secret Tuesday meetings. He tells her to go back and dig, but avoid getting caught.

Annie goes to the storage area, claiming she needs to get a priceless painting she left there. She goes to Frederico's locker and takes his time card and goes up to the senator's office.

She finds a light on inside and opens the door. She sees Ashley with her shirt off climbing onto the senator's lap.

Back at Langley, she asks Auggie how to get a duplicate swipe card. Army guys bring computers in for Auggie. She tells him about seeing her brother-in-law coming out of a hotel.

Jai has found Jarvis' charges at restaurants that indicate Ashley isn't his first mistress.

Annie hears Auggie talking with his old Army buddies on video conference.

Annie jogs down to the docks to "run into" Ashley after she rows. They go get coffee.

Annie comes home in time to see Michael leaving with another excuse. Danielle tells Annie he's working out of Baltimore this week, every day.

Joan tells Auggie she needs him back from his special assignment. He asks her to leave him on it because it's guys from his old unit.

Annie arrives at the senator's office to see Madeline chatting with an old college friend who's now married to the Indonesian ambassador. Before they leave, Annie watches Madeline take a flash drive from a staffer's laptop.

Ashley comes in and Annie convinces her to blow off work.

At the bar, Annie butters up Ashley with girl-talk bonding, then offers up she thinks the senator likes Ashley. Ashley tells Annie their marriage isn't what it seems and she's in love with him. She says he's going to leave his wife.

Later, Annie reports in to Jai about Ashley's dish. She thinks Ashley wouldn't have blabbed if she were the leak. She asks Jai to look into Tina Varma, the wife of the Indonesian ambassador.

Annie sneaks back in the senator's office. A security guy does a late night check. Annie finds a letter supposedly from the senator about Ashley selling secrets and snaps a picture. It's a resignation speech. Madeline wrote it, planning to frame Ashley.

Joan holds a conference, telling everyone they'll pick up Madeline and have her feed bogus intel to her contacts to flush them out.

Annie tells Auggie she's sure Michael is lying to Danielle. Auggie's bummed because he thinks his old buddies don't have confidence in him. Annie gives him a pep talk.

Annie tails Madeline with a team of agents. She goes into a book store and leaves something in a book then hails a cab.

Annie goes to hail a cab and runs smack into her brother in law. He tells her it's not what she thinks and asks her not to tell.

Annie watches as Madeline has lunch with her old friend Tina. Tina tells her she knows it's been hard, but she did the right thing.

When Tina leaves, Annie sits down with Mrs. Jarvis, asking her to come to Langley.

Joan meets with Madeline at Langley. She says Tina told her no one would get hurt. She says she helped get her husband where he is, but he changed.

Joan tells Annie that Ashley has to take the fall so the Indonesians will buy that their contact is still safe. Joan says workplace romances are always complicated, and the camera meaningfully shows Jai.

Auggie leads his mission and Annie sees him and is convinced to look at the bigger picture. Annie goes to see Ashley.

At Langley, Gil meets with Madeline. Jai asks to speak to Joan outside.

Jai points out if they frame Ashley the Indonesian will want to tie up the loose end. Joan sends him after her.

On the dock, Annie explains how Madeline framed her. She took notes from the senator after his briefings and he divulged classified information. Her notes and Internet searches are the only paper trail.

Gil tells Joan the names of the operations his wife leaked. One of them is Goliath, the mission Auggie is currently running. Joan goes to tell him, but he says they're already radio silent.

Auggie scrambles to re-establish contact.

Annie waits for Ashley as she puts away her rowing gear, then realizes a guy she saw earlier on the dock left his skull on the water. From her car, Annie watches as he comes up on Ashley with a syringe and the garage door closes in front of her.

Annie runs around for another way in and uses an oar to take out Ashley's attacker. But he gets free and runs after Ashley, knocking Annie down and dazing her. The guy is choking Ashley with a chain when Annie shoots a flare gun at him, then essentially beats him up with a racing skull, bouncing him off it.

Back with Auggie, they're out of ways to contact the team until Auggie suggests they smash the drone into the compound his guys are approaching. He says they'll get the warning.

They crash the drone and wait to hear. The mission abort signal comes through from the guys. They're OK.

At the racing club, Jai pulls up and is relieved to see Annie is OK. Annie tells Ashley with her attacker in custody she won't need to take the fall.

Cut to Senator Jarvis's resignation press conference.

Back home outside, Michael tells Annie he lost his job two months ago. He was at a job fair at the hotel. Annie urges him to tell Danielle the truth.

Jarvis apologizes to his wife and Ashley in a press conference as we see Ashley packing up.

From her room in the guest house, Annie can see Michael telling Danielle and her hugging him.

description: Annie and Auggie work together in the field to obtain a code from a Russian hacker--a woman who also just so happens to be Auggie's ex-girlfriend.
tags: ['man wrapped in a towel', 'woman wears black lingerie', 'hacker', 'ex girlfriend', 'jumping from a moving train', 'thumb drive', 'u.s. canadian border', 'flying in a business jet', 'turning off the lights', 'riding a train', 'fake identification', 'fake survey', 'reference to james bond', 'blind man', 'slapped in the face', 'close up of mouth', 'tattoo', 'reference to martha stewart', 'cyber attack', 'bare chested male', 'communication satellite', 'title based on song', 'reference to led zeppelin']
synopsis_with_character_names:
We zoom up into space and see the lights on a satellite go from green to red. At Langley, dozens of analysts try to figure out what has just happened to their computers. Traffic lights all flash red.

At home, Danielle (Anne Dudek) complains about the internet not working. The TV is out, too. She's got a photo shoot set up to launch a catering business and gets Annie (Piper Perabo) to pose.

Liza Hearn (Emmanuelle Vaugier), the reporter who's been aggravating Arthur (Peter Gallagher) and writing things about the CIA, tells someone in the other room the cable is out. It's Auggie (Christopher Gorham). She says he's not the only one he knows at the CIA (so maybe he's not the leak). He's ready to stay and play house more when he hears his phone is out, too. He wonders if it's the 13th already.

At work, Auggie tells Joan (Kari Matchett) it wasn't an accident. The Data Tech conference starts today. He wants to go in. She tells him it's already set up.

Data Tech is 1,000 hackers sitting down with law enforcement to swap ideas. Joan briefs the troops on the cyber attack. The hack looks like one in 2007, except it took advantage of something they'd never seen before.

They think Natasha Petrovna (Liane Balaban) might be behind the attack. Auggie explains she's his ex-girlfriend.

She's from Russia. She just spent two years in prison for a hack.

They want Auggie to negotiate a consulting deal with her. Auggie thinks Natasha is an idealist and won't go for money.

Auggie points out to Joan if he makes the deal, she'll know he's a spy. Joan realizes.

Jai (Sendhil Ramamurthy) brings Annie photos security wants taken down from the Internet. They're the ones Danielle took that morning.

Annie takes Auggie to his place to change into a Super Mario Bros 1Up t-shirt. At Data Tech, Auggie briefs her on what the various types look like.

The people on the dais are former criminals now consulting. Natasha asks a question of the FBI about warrantless wiretaping.

Annie narrates for Auggie, telling him Natasha appears to be turning down money from fancy Europeans.

Auggie stops her. Natasha slaps him. "I didn't see that coming," he says. When she says he should have, he explains he meant it literally, because he's blind.
